overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund and repeal two existing conference center funds. [12] This measure establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [11] It repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and appropriates funds out of the new fund. [11] [11]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 for conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. [11] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [11]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [12]
agency_impact: The Committee on Ways and Means received written comments in support of this measure from the University of Hawaii System. [12] Establishing a single revolving fund for all conference center activities will help to standardize conference center programs across all campuses of the University of Hawaii System. [12] It will also facilitate the administration of conference center moneys. [12]
economic_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [12]
policy_impact: This measure repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [11] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [11] A new section is added to chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [11] [11]
revenue_sources: The university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund is established for conference center programs conducted by the university. [11] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [11] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund at the University of Hawaii at Hilo and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the credit of the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [11] [11]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [12]
operating_revenue_impact: The measure establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [11] The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing these services. [11] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [11]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [12]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The provided documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [12]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The previous fiscal note was based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1. [12] This fiscal note is based on H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, which was amended by the Committee on Ways and Means. [12] [12] The committee amended the measure by clarifying the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [12] [12] The committee also made technical nonsubstantive amendments for purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [12]
fte_positions: The provided documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [12]
appropriations_changes: The appropriation amount remains unspecified in the S.D. 2 version of the bill. [11] It appropriates the sum of $ (HB1169_SD2) for fiscal year 2025-2026. [11] This is consistent with the previous S.D. 1 version. [12]
funding_sources_changes: The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the funding sources for this measure compared to the previous version. [12]
department_impact: The provided documents do not indicate any changes to the department responsible for this measure; the university of Hawaii remains the expending agency. [11]
reports_required: The university shall submit a report to the legislature no later than twenty days prior to the convening of each regular session. [11] This report must account for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [11]
pilot_program: The provided documents do not establish a pilot program. [12]
sunset_date: The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [12]
effective_date: This Act shall take effect upon its approval. [11] Section 5, relating to the appropriation, shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [11] [11]
